sentences.english: Over there, a man performed the slow-motion dance of tai chi.
sentences.chinese: 那边，一个男人在练习动作舒缓的太极。

sentences.english: To play Taijiquan, you have to keep a quiet mind.
sentences.chinese: 打太极拳时，你必须保持内心平静。

sentences.english: Huang taiji at noon on the second day if the killer is not on the monkey to justice was put to death on her.

sentences.english: Hubei Wudang Mountain Tai Chi and other six Lake cableway cableway.
sentences.chinese: 湖北武当山太极湖索道等六条索道。

sentences.english: Sea LanZhu coma lying in bed, defends huang taiji in the bedside old a lot.
sentences.chinese: 海兰珠一直昏迷躺在床上，皇太极守在床边苍老不少。

sentences.english: The Huang Taiji Period was the important stage that the Qing Dynasty political power turned from armed administration to literary administration.
sentences.chinese: 皇太极时期是清朝政权由武治向文治转变的重要阶段。

sentences.english: McDull has to go to Wudang Mountain to study taijiquan.
sentences.chinese: 而悲惨的麦兜却要到武当山上学太极。

sentences.english: Practice yoga, tai chi, or Qigong.
sentences.chinese: 练习瑜伽，太极或者气功。

sentences.english: It has a good effect on life preservation and cure.
sentences.chinese: 心意太极拳对养生和防病治病有很好的功效。

sentences.english: This paper aims at setting forth opinions on the issue of the author of Taiji Tu.
sentences.chinese: 本文旨在对《太极图》的作者问题提出个人的看法。

sentences.english: Practicing Quan is to calm your mind.
sentences.chinese: 太极拳更重视修身养性，心神安静。

sentences.english: Taichi Sanshou is the extension of Taichi push-hands exercise.
sentences.chinese: 太极散手是太极推手技法的延伸。

sentences.english: Taichi Sanshou is the extension of Taichi push-hands exercise.
sentences.chinese: 太极散手是太极推手技法的延伸。

sentences.english: Taijiquan is an especially helpful exercise to both old and young.
sentences.chinese: 太极拳是一种老少皆宜的运动。

sentences.english: B: Yes. I do one set of shadow-boxing every morning after I get up.
sentences.chinese: 是的，我每天早上起来都打一趟太极拳。

sentences.english: Taijijian (literally "Taiji Sword") is a straight two-edged sword used in the training of the Chinese martial art Taijiquan.
sentences.chinese: 太极剑是笔直的双刃剑，用于中国武术太极拳训练。
